item.title: Man Drives Car Into Crowd in Southern China, Killing at Least 35
item.description: The police in the city of Zhuhai detained a man who they said had rammed a small vehicle into people who were exercising at a sports center.

item.title: Why ‘Affordable Housing’ in New York City Can Still Cost $3,500 a Month
item.description: Soaring rents and few options have made it hard for average people to live in the city. Even “affordable” units often cost too much.

item.title: Married for 54 Years, Two Poll Workers Die in Election Day Flood
item.description: Chuck and Cathie Baldwin were caught in a flash flood as they drove to the polls. Known as “proud hippies,” they hosted a musical festival called Chuc...

item.title: Biden Officials Try to Reassure COP29 Climate Talks
item.description: Negotiators at the summit in Azerbaijan fear that the return of Donald Trump will sap momentum for global climate action.

item.title: Exxon Chief to Trump: Don’t Withdraw From Paris Climate Deal
item.description: Darren Woods was one of only a few Western oil executives attending a global climate conference in Baku, Azerbaijan.
